text:
Hi all,

Is there a way to add html to the standard_footer_includes from a custom module?
There are required_css, required_js and required_head for example. But no requred_footer.

I tried `require_js, position:"footer"`  but since it’s HTML that I want to add, if doesn’t work property.
Are you using g the language module? This should happen automatically on any page with a translation

Hi:

I use hubdb and "select". What is wrong with the output code? I want the output from variable positiontype

The output code is:

_'''<div class="event-section">_
      _<hr>_
      _<h2 class="event-section-header">_
        _Stillingstype_
      _</h2>_
      _<p>_
         _{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.positiontype }}_
      _</p>_
     
    _</div>'''_
what are you trying to add that is html to the footer?

placing code in slack use the key next to the 1 key and above the tab key three times `  <-- that key will produce
```<p>a place you can insert code</p>```

`_{{ <http://dynamic_page_hubdb_row.positiontype.na|dynamic_page_hubdb_row.positiontype.na>_me _}}` will give you what you are looking for --- those id and name are properties of the object you are printing_
How can I get the output that only shows the item that is chosen in the "select"?
You would like to get all the options that are in the drop-down menu?
You need to look at the hubdb column look up api
I want to publish only the text that is given in the chosen field/select
div elements for a custom lightbox that will be filled by javascript.

Add them with the script. JavaScript create element 

Or add them in your template before the body. I think those are your options here
What did you type to get this
Add .name to the end of that. That is the next value you need to type.

PositionType appears to be the column name. So when you are printing that to the page it is showing Id=1. If you had <http://positionType.id|positionType.id> it would print 1. If you did .name it would print Fast.
